metadata.name: Portrait of a Woman
metadata.description:
This is the first in an experimental series. I wanted to find new ways to bring in color so I used chalk and charcoal on the paper before cutting. I had no idea what the piece would look like until I finished cutting and flipped it over for the first time. I’m in love with this process!

The other experimental part of this series is the position of the subjects … I definitely broke some rules and it was totally worth it!

Made from two parts: Hand-cut paper foreground with chalk and charcoal.

The background is canvas with acrylic paint, chalk, and charcoal.

Medium: Mixed media

Materials: Acid-free mix media paper, Chalk, Charcoal, Acrylic paint, Canvas
